Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of the travel ban in saving lives, suggesting that it has been "much more critical" than testing.
Understate: The claim understates the importance of testing in controlling the spread of COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the travel ban has been more critical in saving lives.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the travel ban alone has been effective in preventing the spread of the virus, without considering other public health measures.
Exist alternative explanation: The experts suggest that better and earlier testing could have saved more lives, indicating an alternative explanation to the claim's emphasis on the travel ban.
